means: 近似，接近( approximate的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: With mathematical problems, you can save time by approximating.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于数学题，可以用取近似值的办法节约时间。

sentence.Network_en: By about 6 weeks of age, most babies begin to show something approximating a day/night sleeping pattern.
sentence.Network_cn: 到6个星期大时，大多数婴儿开始表现出近似于日夜分明的睡觉模式。

sentence.Network_en: Something approximating to a fair outcome will be ensured.
sentence.Network_cn: 保证会有大致公正的结果。

(A-B)英语四级词汇表下载 ... approve vt. 赞成，称许；批准 approximately ad. 近似地，大约 April n. 四月.

entry.def: An approximate number, time, or position is close to the correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.

example.ex: The approximate cost varies from around £150 to £250...
example.tran: 费用大概介于150至250英镑之间。

entry.def: An idea or description that is approximate is not intended to be precise or accurate, but to give some indication of what something is like.

example.ex: They did not have even an approximate idea what the Germans really wanted.
example.tran: 他们完全不清楚德国人真正想要什么。

entry.def: If something approximates to something else, it is similar to it but is not exactly the same.

example.ex: Something approximating to a fair outcome will be ensured...
example.tran: 保证会有大致公正的结果。

example.ex: By about 6 weeks of age, most babies begin to show something approximating a day/night sleeping pattern.
example.tran: 到6个星期大时，大多数婴儿开始表现出近似于日夜分明的睡觉模式。

auth_sentence.content: The scientists ran this experiment several different ways, each approximating a different kind of real-life social group.
auth_sentence.res_content: The scientists ran this experiment several different ways, each approximating a different kind of real-life social group.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The scientists ran this experiment several different ways, each approximating a different kind of real-life social group.
